Title: The actual challenges of financial literacy
Authors: J. W. Mitchell, Magipervas E Abusheva
Abstract summary: The main challenges for financial literacy include lack of knowledge, overconfidence, lack of government initiatives, and lack of engaging ways to teach financial skills.

Title: Analysis of Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) for Financial Literacy on Kids Application Technology
Venue: Turkish Journal of Computer and Mathematics Education
Abstract summary: The paper examines the acceptance of technology as a method to teach financial literacy to children.

Title: Children and Financial Education: Challenges for Developing Financial Capability in the Classroom
Abstract summary: Delivering effective financial education for children in the classroom faces challenges around values, diversity, and teacher training.

Title: importance of early financial literacy management skills
Authors: S. Sabirin, Benius Benius, S. Neneng, Solikah Nurwati, Sri Lestari Hendrayati
Venue: International journal of business, economics & management
Abstract summary: Early financial literacy education for children can boost economic growth and stability, but faces challenges like resource requirements and specialized teachers.

Title: INTERNATIONAL OF MULTIDISCIPLINARY: APPLIED BUSINESS AND EDUCATION RESEARCH Financial Challenges and Practices of Business Administration Students of a State University in Dumaguete City
Authors: Mary Jane Zamora, M. Polinar, A. Delantar
Abstract summary: The main financial challenges for business administration students are obtaining part-time jobs and affording internet access for online classes, while their main financial practice is saving money.

Title: Designing for Financial Literacy: How Adolescent Learning through a Mobile Application
Authors: Kintan Sekar Adinda, Ginar Santika Niwanputri
Venue: 2021 8th International Conference on Advanced Informatics: Concepts, Theory and Applications (ICAICTA)
Abstract summary: A mobile application designed using user-centered design and gamification can improve financial literacy among adolescents.

Title: Financial Literacy Programs Targeted on Pre-School Children: Development and Evaluation
Authors: Karen C. Holden, Charles W. Kalish, Laura Scheinholtz, Deanna Dietrich, Beatriz Novak
Abstract summary: This paper reviews financial literacy programs targeted at pre-school children, their cognitive development, and evaluation of program effectiveness.

Title: "Money shouldn't be money!" : An Examination of Financial Literacy and Technology for Children Through Co-Design
Authors: Jason C. Yip, Frances Marie Tabio Ello, Fumi Tsukiyama, Atharv Wairagade, June Ahn
Venue: International Conference on Interaction Design and Children
Abstract summary: Children's perspectives on financial literacy and the role of digital technologies in their financial understanding.
